description: From Middle English foreseen, forseen, from Old English foresēon; equivalent to fore- +‎ see. Similar formations in Dutch voorzien, German vorsehen, Latin prōvideō.

verbs.description: foresee (third-person singular simple present foresees, present participle foreseeing, simple past foresaw, past participle foreseen)

entries.meaning: To be able to see beforehand: to anticipate; predict.
examples: "I foresee in this," he says, "the breaking up of our profession."
